description:
Pudding made from mango, sugar and condensed milk, thickened with agar or gelatin. This dish is likely descended from an Indian mango pudding.

**Characters**

{芒果} is the [loanword](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loanword) for [mango](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mango) (which is taken from the Portuguese *manga* which is from the Malay *mangga* which in turn came from the Tamil *mankay*), and [布甸](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E5%B8%83%E7%94%B8) is the [loanword](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loanword) for [pudding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pudding).

This is sometimes listed as [芒果布丁](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8A%92%E6%9E%9C%E5%B8%83%E4%B8%81), using the more common Mandarin word for [pudding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pudding) [布丁](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E5%B8%83%E4%B8%81) sounds a little closer (“bou dīng” in Cantonese, “bù dīng” in Mandarin).

Baked [tapioca pudding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tapioca_pudding) with a carmealized top and creamy center.

**Characters**

{西} is *West* or *Western*, {米} is *rice* or more generally *grain*, and {布甸} is the [loanword](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loanword) for [pudding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pudding), so 西米布甸 is *Western rice pudding*.

{西米} is also the term for [sago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sago), which is similar to [tapioca](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tapioca), so this dish name also refers to [sago pudding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sago_pudding).
